subject: Re: [junit] Junit & CORBA
msgSnippet: Hi! yeah, sure you can test your CORBA connections with junit. I just had problems with visibroker and the classloader of Junit which is just used with the
messageBody:
Hi!

yeah, sure you can test your CORBA connections with junit. I just had
problems with visibroker and the classloader of Junit which is just
used with the swing-Gui. With the textui it works pretty well.
But I think its also a good idea to have a mock corbaconnection to test
without CORBA.
So low level stuff is testet with CORBA and the high level stuff is
testet with a mock controller, wich gets data from some XML files.

martin

Am 13.11.2002 15:54, schrieben/st Sie/du :

> Has anybody developed tests with Junit in a CORBA
> environment? The code I am testing uses CORBA
> extensively and I was wondering if I should even go
> down the path of using Junit or just develop tests
> without junit.
>
> Ty
